body_html:
@apaszke initializers are tensors that are exported together with a model in an onnx file. In our case they are the parameters of the model (https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/blob/master/torch/onnx/utils.py#L189), which must be provided as arguments to the graph after the actual inputs for evaluation.

Update: to clarify, the name comes from the onnx proto (https://github.com/onnx/onnx/blob/master/onnx/onnx.proto3#L248)
body_text:
@apaszke initializers are tensors that are exported together with a model in an onnx file. In our case they are the parameters of the model (https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/blob/master/torch/onnx/utils.py#L189), which must be provided as arguments to the graph after the actual inputs for evaluation.
Update: to clarify, the name comes from the onnx proto (https://github.com/onnx/onnx/blob/master/onnx/onnx.proto3#L248)
body:
@apaszke initializers are tensors that are exported together with a model in an onnx file. In our case they are the parameters of the model (https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/blob/master/torch/onnx/utils.py#L189), which must be provided as arguments to the graph after the actual inputs for evaluation.

**Update**: to clarify, the name comes from the `onnx` proto (https://github.com/onnx/onnx/blob/master/onnx/onnx.proto3#L248)
